content:
Diagnosis:
Locally advanced esophageal squamous cell carcinoma ypT3N1M0, p16 positive, PDL1 CPS 25

Previous Treatment:
Completed neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy March 2024 - 50Gy in 25 fractions with concurrent cisplatin/5FU
Transthoracic esophagectomy performed 15 May 2024

Current Situation:
Post-operative recovery phase with good functional recovery

Current symptoms:
Mild dysphagia to solids only
Maintaining weight with supplementary drinks
Good exercise tolerance

Investigation Results:
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis 20 June 2024 - No evidence of recurrent or metastatic disease
Endoscopy 25 June 2024 - Anastomosis healthy with no evidence of stricture or recurrence

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent investigations. He has made an excellent recovery from his esophagectomy with minimal post-operative complications. His swallowing has gradually improved and he is now managing a soft diet supplemented with nutritional drinks. His weight has stabilized at 72kg (pre-treatment weight 78kg). Performance status has improved to PS1.

Given his high-risk pathological features (ypT3N1 with lymphovascular invasion) and PDL1 CPS score of 25, I have discussed with him the role of adjuvant immunotherapy. The CheckMate 577 trial data shows significant disease-free survival benefit with adjuvant nivolumab in this setting. He understands the potential benefits and risks, including immune-related adverse events.

Plan:
To commence adjuvant nivolumab 480mg every 4 weeks for one year
Baseline thyroid function, cortisol, and chest x-ray arranged
Provided immunotherapy alert card and education regarding side effects
Follow-up in 4 weeks prior to cycle 2
Repeat CT scan in 3 months
